summary: "Frankenstein" is a famous novel by Mary Shelley, published in 1818. It tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a living creature. Shelley started writing at 18, inspired by a dream about a scientist scared by his creation. The book is a mix of Gothic and Romantic styles and has influenced many other stories, films, and plays. It's so popular that people often use "Frankenstein" to describe the monster, even though in the book, Frankenstein is the scientist's name.
title: Frankenstein
